title: Motorcyclist killed by drunk driver in Anne Arundel County
text:
A 23-year-old man on a motorcycle was killed Friday night when he collided with a drunk driver in a box truck at 8:30 p.m. in Odenton, according to authorities.

Ian Gregory Vangenderen, 23, of Odenton, was driving a Harley Davidson on Annapolis Road near Berger Street when he crashed into a GMC box truck whose driver had pulled out of a parking lot in front of him, Anne Arundel police said.

Vangenderen, who had the right-of-way, died at the scene, police said.

The driver of the truck, Kayla Nicole Joy, 21, also of Odenton, was not injured.

Joy was charged with homicide by motor vehicle while under the influence of alcohol, driving under the influence of alcohol and failure to yield right of way, among other counts.
